data.title: Exceptional
data.text: Really excellent selection of homemade deli style salads, pasta, sandwiches and wraps made with care and attention. I was on my way to the McDonald's opposite when I saw the sign and thought I'd give it a try, I'm so glad I did. It couldn't be more different with healthy wholesome food and fresh ingredients. I had the falafel but it all looked great. My only issue is I wish they were open for dinner on a Saturday so I could go back tonight!

data.title: Good food
data.text: A lot of healthy choices to eat and else regular food prices are like outside very cool location in downtown in the basement .

data.title: Just Good Food
data.text: The name is perfect for this establishment. My husband and I have eaten there several times, and he likes to go every St. Patrick's Day as their corned beef and cabbage is excellent. In his words " the food is cooked to perfection, they do not overcook the cabbage as most restaurants do, there is form left and a wonderful taste. I had a turkey sandwich on rye that was good as well. The cupcakes we purchased were dry, and the icing lacked flavor, which was the only food I've ever had there that was not wonderful. As it is more of a sandwich place, the silverware is plastic, which has not been a problem as the food is tender.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: I enjoy sneaking over here during my lunch hour. The food is always great as is the service.  They wait on you quickly even though during the lunch hour it is packed.

data.title: Great local spot
data.text: Good lunch spot.  Fresh sandwiches and salads.  Traditional Main Street Deli feel to it.  Visited twice now, will definitely go back.

data.title: I have eaten there many times.
data.text: "Just Good Food" sells itself short.  The food is excellent.  And their catering is the best in town, and at a reasonable price.  This is not a fine dining establishment, however.  You order food at a counter and then take it to your own place.  It would be romantic if you are just starting to date and everything is romantic or if you've been together a while and want a quiet place to eat and talk.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot!
data.text: This underground lunch spot has many delicious food items to choose from! Try different salads, pastas and desserts at this restaurant. Recommend chicken quesadilla and Jen's pasta!

data.title: Great Name!
data.text: My son and I recently had lunch here. What a delicious spot! They had several sandwich choices that were unique and tasty. They also had many homemade take-out offerings that looked wonderful as well.  We'll be back!

data.title: Great food for museum goers!
data.text: Getting hungry at the museum across the street I asked for any nearby food options. I was thrilled to find this hidden little gem. Fantastic artisan sandwiches and great creative and healthy sides! My whole family LOVED their choices. Cool location. Make sure not to miss this place if you're downtown and need lunch.

data.title: Excellent deli!
data.text: Really nice range of delicious sandwiches and salads. Everything is fresh, and there are some really unique choices. Their mexican-style food is my favorite, but even a turkey sandwich here is something special. Great place for a lunch!

data.title: RUDE Customer Service
data.text: On Wed, the day before Thanksgiving, I went to pick up the turkey my wife had ordered on the 11th.  As I was waiting in line with 7 other customers, the manager or owner, I don't know which, finally came out of her office only to yell across the store, "Look at all the people that can't follow direction."  I was shocked, but waited my turn.  As she reached the register, she made another very rude comment about us being there too early.  When it was my turn she counted the people in line and once again announced that there where 7 people that can't follow directions.  I told we were told we could pick up the turkey after 9:00am on Wednesday.  She looked at me and said, "No you weren't, it says right here in the flier to pick up after 10:00."  I let her know that we don't get the fliers, we just called.  She said a few more rude comments and I told her to just give me my $20.00 deposit back.  After trying a number of times she COULD NOT FIND OUR ORDER.  I asked to right down that I did not get a turkey and I would be back.  I made a trip home to print out my debit card statement showing it HAD been paid for and made another trip downtown.  While she was trying to find the mistake in the computer again, I asked to just give me the $20.00.  She offered to sell me a turkey off the truck, but I told her because of the incredibly rude way she treated me that morning that I would rather eat hotdogs for Thanksgiving than buy from her.  I will tell you that the other employees I spoke to there were very friendly and even offered me one of their cookies, but because of this terribly rude "boss" I will not return.

data.title: The name gives it away - Just Good Food
data.text:
My kids and I were at the children's museum all morning so when lunch time came around we were all quite hungry.
And since the only other option in this area is Mc Donald's my choice was clear.
Little did I know that this was probably the best decision I've made in a while.
Just Good Food is located in the basement of an office building so it's actually not really inviting but don't be fooled by the location.
They offer a huge variety of mostly organic and all natural foods which seem to be inspired by all kinds of cuisines from all over the world.
It felt like in an orienral basar and the colors, aromas and textures are just flat out mouth watering.
I admit to ordering a PB & J sandwich (shame on me but it was for my kids) BUT here's the catch. We got two gigantic slices of oat bread which had been baked that very morning, slathered with the most delicious freshly made peanut butter and topped off with home made preserves. It was absolutely amazing and I've never seen my kids eat a sandwich that fast.
I had ordered curried chicken salad with cashews in pita bread which was so rich in flavor, color and texture that I could've eaten a whole bucket full of it. 
They also have a huge variety of hummus, guacamole, all kinds of salads..... 
You can probably tell that I am in love with this place and I can only advice you to give this place a try. It is oh so worth it.
